name: podamShouldHandleFloatValuesWithThePodamFloatValueAnnotation

testSteps.description: When I invoke the factory manufacturing for <span class='step-parameter'>class uk.co.jemos.podam.test.dto.annotations.FloatValuePojo

Then the Object FloatRangeValuesPojo ( floatFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0.0 floatFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 18.395275 floatFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 985.8881 floatFieldWithPreciseValue = 123456.0 floatObjectFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0.0 floatObjectFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 26.701063 floatObjectFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 758.8421 floatObjectFieldWithPreciseValue = 123456.0 ) should not be null
Then the Float value 0.0 should be greater or equal than 0.0
Then the float value 18.395275 should be lower or equal than 100.0
Then the float value 985.8881 should be between 0.0 and 1000.0
Then the Object 0.0 should not be null
Then the Float value 0.0 should be greater or equal than 0.0
Then the Object 26.701063 should not be null
Then the float value 26.701063 should be lower or equal than 100.0
Then the Object 758.8421 should not be null
Then the float value 758.8421 should be between 0.0 and 1000.0
Then the float value 123456.0 should be precisely 123456.0
Then the Object 123456.0 should not be null
Then the float value 123456.0 should be precisely 123456.0

title: Podam should handle both native and wrapped float values with @PodamFloatValue annotation
